DOC.brief_summary: The primary aim protocol determine whether use repetitive transcranial magnetic stimulation ( rTMS ) vermis cerebellum may safe therapeutically effective patient schizophrenia . Because first evaluation treatment population , focus study safety .
DOC.criteria: 1 . Age 1865 year 2 . Diagnosis schizophrenia accord DSMIV criterion ( boardcertified psychiatrist ) 1 . Prior neurosurgical procedure 2 . Any history seizure 3 . Previous head injury 4 . Contraindication TMS : 1 . Implanted pacemaker 2 . Medication pump 3 . Vagal stimulator 4 . Deep brain stimulator 5 . Metallic hardware head scalp : shrapnel , surgical clip , fragment weld 6 . Signs increase intracranial pressure 5 . TENS unit ventriculoperitoneal shunt 6 . Pregnancy lactate ; note negative pregnancy test require patient female reproductive year 7 . Advanced liver , kidney , cardiac , pulmonary disease define clinically terminal medical diagnosis consistent survival < 1 year 8 . A history significant alcohol drug abuse prior six month 9 . No focal cortical insult present , include tumor vascular malformation 10 . Patients may actively enrol separate intervention study 11 . Patients unable undergo brain MR : a. claustrophobia refractory anxiolytic ferromagnetic metal body prosthetic heart valve , pacemaker , brain aneurysm clip ) . 12 . Change antipsychotic medication last 4 week 13 . Any emergency psychiatry department visit last 4 week 14 . Been inpatient psychiatry clinic within last month 15 . Any axis I diagnosis
